title: 115_hr1248
content: The Act may be cited as the "Make Our Government Safe Act". Congress finds that Steve Bannon was appointed as chief strategist and senior counselor to the President in January 2017, and later appointed to the National Security Council. The National Security Council is responsible for integrating domestic, foreign, and military policies for national security. Access to compartmented information is required for participation in sensitive NSC meetings. Steve Bannon, appointed as chief strategist and senior counselor to the President, has advocated for overthrowing the US Government by force, as indicated in security clearance questions. Bannon referred to himself as a "Leninist" in support of such actions. Steve Bannon, appointed as chief strategist and senior counselor to the President, has advocated for overthrowing the US Government by force, referring to himself as a "Leninist" with the goal of bringing down the establishment. The Director of the National Background Investigations Bureau testified about the scrutiny of applicants for security clearances, highlighting concerns raised by Bannon's self-identification as a Leninist. Director Phalen emphasized the need to thoroughly question individuals who express intentions to "destroy the state" in order to provide a comprehensive assessment to the adjudicator. He also stated that background check investigators would verify the truth if Bannon denied making such statements. SEC. 3 prohibits individuals who threaten to destroy the government from participating in or attending National Security Council meetings. Individuals who threaten to destroy the government are prohibited from participating in or attending National Security Council meetings. This amendment to the National Security Act of 1947 will take effect 30 days after the enactment of the Act. Congress believes that federal employees who threaten to destroy the State or take hostile actions against the United States should have their security clearances suspended to prevent any threat to the country.
